inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content: Used as a measuring device. Quickly applicable and very universal. When the foil is glowing in a certain color that is linked to a certain flow velocity under that foil section, it could indicate flow problems within a pipe grid. That would mean, that many foil are applied on many pipe sections.
inov:hasTextualRefinement.dcterms:description: Which problem does the idea solve?

gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: Foil that is wrapped around a pipe, to measure the flow velocity of the fluid inside. Foil is acting as sender as well as receiver for signals sent through pipe wall and fluid. The flow value is displayed by the foil as well.

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content: Instead of showing the flow velocity (or volume flow or mass flow) in numbers it could show a defined color scale from low to high flows.
inov:hasTextualRefinement.dcterms:description: Describe your idea in more detail (e.g., how is it used?)

gi2mo:Idea.dcterms:title: Flow Measuring Foil

gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: With the help of TCO, simple measurements can be carried out in urban areas that would otherwise require more complex installations. gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: TCO is covering a transparent fridge door, giving an indication (LEDs) about expired food, contents, use of energy, temperature, and other useful information. In the same time, it has touch sensitive capabilities.

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content:
on fridges: A user can "select" specific food by tipping the front door and gets overlay information about content without opening the fridge door.
on vending machines: The user can select products in a way more natural style than typing in a product number. He can get overlay LED indications as well.
inov:hasTextualRefinement.dcterms:description: Which problem does the idea solve?

gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: Every piece of cloth that has the TCO technology in it is changing its color when it needs to be washed. Therefore the person knows by one look which clothes need to be washed and which can be used again.

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content: imagine you have a pile of clothes in your room and its cleenup day. you want to seperate clean from dirty. also: you need to pick up your clothes of the day really quickly cause you're in a hurry. all the TCO-clothes that need to be washed and shouldnt be worn for another round all turn into one colour (for example orange). so sorting int out is made easy you know right away which clothes you can still wear.

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content: Scenario: person buys a yoghurt container and eats one spoon out of it. Then forgets about it. After a week, the person is not sure whether the yoghurt is still edible or not. When the package is using TCO-technology the package itself can indicate whether the food inside is still good. the whole package turns red and/or has a caution sign indicationg that the food has gone bad.

gi2mo:Idea.dcterms:title: night glow
gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: The TCO film concept can be used in situations in which a rudimentary glowing indication is needed at night, but at daytime should be transparent and not noticeable.

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content: Because of the simple circuit construction of glowing LEDs and a light sensor, it is very easy to produce TCO film sheets which can light up a word or a symbol at night. These films are transparent and could cover architecture or beautiful surfaces which need to be seen at daytime. This tech could be used for advertising at night, safety indication in all public spaces and public transports, in domestic areas, offices, childcare products, the guidance systems etc.
inov:hasTextualRefinement.dcterms:description: Describe your idea in more detail (e.g., how is it used?)

gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: Many burglars break into retail stores, offices, or houses by crashing a window. This could be prevented by putting electricity on the glass wall, as soon as the owner is no longer at home, or the shop is closed, or best when the alarm is set up. This way, if a burgler tries to break the glass-window, he/she gets shocked by electricity.

gi2mo:MinMaxRating.dcterms:description: If you could buy such a product, how likely would you do so?

gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: TCO-tattoos are THE perfect solution for indecisive people, that cannot commit to have a tattoo all days for every day. TCO-tattoos can be "switched off" and the tattoo will not be seen for as long as the carrier wants to. Same applies to "switched on"
gi2mo:Idea.dcterms:title: (un)visible tattoos

gi2mo:Idea.dcterms:title: interaktive sticker

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content:
the system doesn't always have to actively control for example an radiator - it could also tell the user how he should react /or what to do …
also when there is no light switch in the corner of the room you could constitute any object and give it a extra function.

inov:ResourceCandidate.inov:text: could attached to surface in home

gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: an invisible sticker could be attached to any surface in your home and connects via wifi to a „smart-home-hub“ it would make preexisting „non-smart“ objects like doorhandles and light switches „smart“ when combined with a certain behavior. example:if a window is opened at a certain temperature the air-condition reacts and stops heating - cause not every part of a system has to be able to react.

Change window-color depending on the UV, so that if the sun is shining the color changes to something darker (like the windows within some cars) and if there is no sun or less sun, let the window remain as it is. Similar technology is already in use for glasses.

gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: Transparent coating applied by spraying or as adhesive mat. The layer reacts on different impacts (mechanical micro-disruption, temperature, vibration, chemicals, ...) and indicates the affected area by changing from transparant to a highly visible color. Could be used for sensitive parts like wings of planes or important elements of a bridge.

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content: Example: When a pilot is surrounding the plane prior start for a visual check, that would help him tremendously to recognize problems.
inov:hasTextualRefinement.dcterms:description: Which problem does the idea solve?

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content: An electronic circuit finish for solar energy generating surfaces which does not block any light.

inov:hasTextualRefinement.gi2mo:content: The idea solves the problem that solar panels are flat and need a lot of space to be installed either in landscapes or if they are installed on objects With TCO other shapes can be produced which are more flexible and need less space.
